title: How does threading work?
content:
I promise I searched and read messages, but could not understand how threading works in Thunderbird. With respect to all the other apps I use, I consider threading in Thunderbird unusable.

- New emails assigned to a thread, do not clearly show on top of the list (depending on the sort criteria of the mailbox/folder).

- Sometimes, emails get grouped in the same thread even if they have a different subject. I assume Thuderbird uses fields different to the email subject, but there should be a way not to automtically group messages whose subject is different.

Is there a link to a documentation page that helps in making sense of threading?
creator: lordthistle

content:
Buenas tardes, quería saber si existe la posibilidad de crear una regla la cual, que yo al enviar un correo, este mismo rebote en mi bandeja de entrada, esto es porque tengo unos usuarios que tienen una misma cuenta de correo y queremos que cuando alguno envié un correo en el otro computador quede también registrado ese correo enviado, por aquello lo de crear una regla para poder reenviar el mismo correo a ese mismo correo.

creator: felipemendezsilv

title: Search,
content:
Hi All,

I am a loooong time user of TB. I think this has been addressed several time, however I would like to add my stone here.

I get constantly and more and more frustrated by the way "search" works - or, more precisely, the way it fails. The beginning looks good, there is a search bar and it is based on a sqlite database, and fast.

What is bad is that I have several occurences where the data is not found. i am talking about a simple word in a sentence. Eg, it cannot find an email send by a client who type his first name as a signature, when i do a search on that name. Isnt that frustrating. And no, rebuilding the index did not help. Why this fails, is beyond my understanding (I understand bug exists, but this has been around for 2-3 years). Is there anything I can do to help sort that out ??

On the improvement side I would wish to see a search with more options, ie, between two dates, and more importantly, a search based on the sender. -- Am i wrong, or at this stage there is no way to search based on the sender ?

Tx
creator: pousset.christophe

title: Get Messages triggers antivirus
content: I use Thunderbird with multiple email accounts, and whenever it gets emails Bitdefender reports "the file c:\users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\newmsg is infected". I have tried getting messages for each account individually to troubleshoot but still cannot determine which account or what email is triggering this. How do I fix this?
creator: orrjl

title: Error con el arranque de IMAP en thunderbird
content:
Hola !!

Desde hoy me aparece un error al entrar a mi correo de thunderbird que dice: "No es posible conectar a su servidor IMAP. Puede que haya superado el número máximo de conexiones a este servidor. Si es así, utilice el cuadro de diálogo de configuraciones avanzadas del servidor IMAP".

He probado hacer lo que dice, y bajar el número máximo de conexiones a la caché a 1, el mínimo. He reiniciado el PC, he probado conectarme a otra red wifi, he reinstalado thunderbird... y nada, aparece el mismo error.

No entiendo como esto ha aparecido de la noche a la mañana. Justo da la casualidad que se produce este error cuando me avisan que se acababa mi "prueba gratutita". Que yo sepa, Thunderbird tiene una versión gratuita que debería funcionar sin problemas. Soy un trabajador autónomo y solo utilizo un ordenador para intercambiar unos pocos correos al día.

Alguien me podría ayudar con este problema, ya que no tengo mucha más información, simplemente no me inicia el IMAP y no puedo usar mi correo.

Se lo agradezco !! Un saludo !!
creator: sergiomorenoingles

title: Cannot Play wav File Attachments in Thunderbird
content:
Latest Fedora 37 I can play wav files on my machine if I first save then open them from Files, but if I attempt to open a wav attachment directly from a mail message in Thunderbird, System Handler opens, a blank dialog box comes up, wav does not play.

In Thunderbird Edit > Settings > Files & Attachments there is an option for how to handle WAV audio - if I select “Use other…” and point it to a application, (have tried several different ones) wav files will still not open.

For example - this does not work: Edit > Settings > Files & Attachments Use other… > /usr/bin/vlc

After setting this way, when I attempt to open and play a wav attachment, nothing happens whatsoever.

This did work consistently in the past on older versions of Thunderbird and OS.

I can open other attachments directly from mail messages - pdf files for example will open in my default pdf application for example.

title: Not sending calendar invitations after following the article about it.
content:
I had a big event related to security on my ISP last year and I moved my calendar and contacts to an internal cardav and caldav server in my hosted Synology NAS. I was able to setup Thunderbird well and I did assigned a calendar identity to the calendar with local management of the invitations. In the configuration, it correctly shows, as in the article (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/enable-email-invitations-caldav-servers-configured) that I prefer Client side email scheduling and I have assigned one of my email accounts. The problem I have is that when I create a calendar entry and state that I want to invite people, by default it states that the organizer is otto.acuna@local.host, not the email identity I assigned and that it shows in properties

Any ideas if this is something I need to edit somewhere internal? Thank you in advance for your help Otto

title: Thunderbird receives but can NOT send emails.
content:
I can receive email using Thunderbird but can NOT send any. When I attempt a send, after a LONG pause Thunderbird displays the message: 

    "Sending the message failed.       The message could not be sent because the connection to the Outgoing server (SMTP)      smtpauth.earthlink.net timed out.  Try again."

I've tried all the suggestions in similar reports - all to no effect. I've deleted and reinstall Thunderbird on the same machine and finally made a new installation on a second machine. I still get the same error whenever I try to send email with Thunderbird! Gmail sends and receives email just fine on either machine and I can also login directly to earthlink.net using the browser and send emails.

Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated!

title: Thunderbird starting slow after upgrading MacOS to Ventura - 30 seconds
content:
My tb has a long starting time after updating to ventura. It´s about 30 to 38 sec. I tryed: -deleting all caches and the startup cache -debug mode without themes and plugins -starting from terminal -tryed to start with admin rights -disabled all plugins -deleted all themes -deleted all calendars and created a default calendar -tb 109 beta 

-looked for the preferences

-deleted ligthning prefs -disabled looking for proxies and disabled dns over https

at last, I tried deleting all the files in the library and started an "out of the box thunderbird". The result was - the same startup time and the same errors. Then I tried an user without icloud and the startup time was normal: less then 2 seconds!

My errors:

2023-01-12 09:17:07.307 thunderbird-bin[14467:896407] Rethrowing (from nts_ValueForProperty:) NSInternalInconsistencyException: Unhandled error (NSCocoaErrorDomain, 134092) occurred during faulting and was thrown: Error Domain=NSCocoaErrorDomain Code=134092 "(null)" CoreData: error: Unhandled error occurred during faulting: Error Domain=NSCocoaErrorDomain Code=134092 "(null)" ({ })

title: Importing .pst into Thunderbird removes addresses in "Sent" folder
content:
A month ago, I decided to give Thunderbird a try as my email client coming from MS Outlook.

I used the import functionality to import my from my Outlook installation's .pst files.

Everything seemed to work and I have been using Thunderbird for a month now.

Today however, I required to look up past sent emails. The Sent folder is there. It imported and the messages are there. Unfortunately the "From" and "To" fields have had their email addresses replaced with just the person's name. This is not consistent but is true perhaps 80% of the time.

The From field of course just has my name The sent field in most cases only has the recipient's name, though there is the rare email that does show the email address.

Is there a method to correct this?

Thanks in advance.
creator: fwilson00

title: No Option to accept/ decline event on mobile(nextcloud)
content:
Im using thunderbird with a nextcloud calendar Nextcloud v25.0.3 Thunderbird v91.13.1 DAVx (to sync on Android)

All my calendars sync across the devices and Ive added my caldav calendars to my mobile devices. When I try send an invite, from Thunderbird, to someone else in our organisation to accept on their mobile, the invitation sends an email with 2 attachments 'invite.vcs' or invite.ics' So there is no option to accept or decline, if I open the attachment the only option I have is to save to calendar, but that will also not send an accept or decline. If I send the email to another address, for example a gmail address, the inivite sends exactly how you would expect and has the accept or decline buttons.

If I send an invite from my mobile device to thunderbird, the invitation sends as expect. But once I try accept or decline in thunderbird, no response seems to be sent back to my mobile device or atleast nothing i can see If I send from mobile device to mobile device, there is an option to accept, which opens a browser window, but atleast the option is there. It also has an attachment, this is 'event.ics'

So I think the issue is somewhere with thunderbird, but Im not sure. Would really appreciate any help
creator: SumoBot

title: TB version 102.6.1 is sometimes unable to save a sent email, either to the host or to the "local" sent folder
content:
See above problem. Today I finally left while TB was supposedly running and working on saving an email message to the local sent folder. It had already informed me it wasn't able to connect or do whatever it needed to do to save the email to the host or whatever it's called, I was using a gmail address. I was away form the machine for well over an hour and when I move the cursor over the list of folders in TB, that circle that shows it's "working" still circling. There is STILL no copy of the email in the sent folder. My internet connection is functioning, I opened up task manager the last time this happened (a week or so ago) and while a fair amount of the CPU was being used, it wasn't overloaded because no other tasks were taking up more then a very small amount of the CPU.

I haven't changed anything recently. Not updated TB, not changed anything else. It's a sporadic problem, sometimes I can send 20 emails & this issue doesn't recur. I would it to not happen anymore--I am particularly unhappy about this email as it was a work email and I need to have a copy of it.
